p: Inhibition of Semliki Forest virus (SFV) entry also by perphenazine was analyzed by Pohjala et al. (2011). The obtained results showed that the drug IC 50 for SFV replication is 25.1 μM, while IC 50 for BHK cell viability is 155.0 μM using reporter gene Renilla luciferase, Rluc screening assay. Moreover, the drug decreased Rluc activity and inhibited Chikungunya virus- Rluc (CHIKV- Rluc) infection (IC 50 = 48.1 μM), and did not influence CHIKV replicon formation. It suggests that perphenazine can decrease entry and replication of the alphavirus and that SFV is a safe model for anti-CHIKV screening ( Pohjala et al., 2011).
